title: B-2 Bombers Strike 2 ISIS Camps In Libya, Killing Dozens Of Terrorists
text:
B-2 Bombers Strike 2 ISIS Camps In Libya, Killing Dozens Of Terrorists "... zero survivors ..." Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
A pair of U.S. Air Force B-2 bombers struck two ISIS training camps Wednesday night about 30 miles outside of the Libyan city of Sirte. A total of 108 precision-guided bombs fell on the camps, killing an estimated 85 terrorists. 
U.S. Defense Secretary Ash Carter said Thursday that some of those killed in the attack were thought to be actively plotting attacks in Europe. 
“We need to strike ISIL everywhere they show up. And that’s particularly true in view of the fact that we know some of the ISIL operatives in Libya were involved with plotting attacks,” Carter said. Advertisement - story continues below 
The Pentagon said in a statement that while officials were still assessing the impact of the strikes, “the initial assessment indicates they were successful.” 
According to ABC News , a counterterrorism official said there were “zero survivors” at the camps. 
The Department of Defense said the air strikes were conducted “in conjunction with the Libyan Government of National Accord,” the country’s interim government. Advertisement - story continues below 
After the B-2 bombers passed through the area, U.S. drones “cleaned up” the operation with hellfire missiles that killed fighters attempting to flee for safety. 
Militants in the area were seen wearing tactical vests and carrying weapons prior to the attacks. 
The B-2 bombers came from Whiteman Air Force Base in Missouri. 
On their way to Libya, they refueled at least five times while in the air, and they completed their entire trip without landing. Advertisement - story continues below
